detach also seems weird:

import torch
x = torch.randn(1,2)
x = torch.autograd.Variable(x)

W = torch.randn(2,3)
W = torch.autograd.Variable(W,requires_grad=True)
W2 = torch.randn(3,4)
W2 = torch.autograd.Variable(W2,requires_grad=True)

xW = torch.mm(x,W)
xW_detach = xW.detach()
xW_detach.requires_grad = True # commenting this line would solve the problem
xWW2 = torch.mm(xW_detach,W2)

loss = torch.sum(torch.pow(xWW2,2).view(-1),0)

loss.backward(retain_graph=False)

Result:
RuntimeError: leaf variable was used in an inplace operation

detach also seems weird:

``` Python
import torch
x = torch.randn(1,2)
x = torch.autograd.Variable(x)

W = torch.randn(2,3)
W = torch.autograd.Variable(W,requires_grad=True)
W2 = torch.randn(3,4)
W2 = torch.autograd.Variable(W2,requires_grad=True)

xW = torch.mm(x,W)
xW_detach = xW.detach()
xW_detach.requires_grad = True # commenting this line would solve the problem
xWW2 = torch.mm(xW_detach,W2)

loss = torch.sum(torch.pow(xWW2,2).view(-1),0)

loss.backward(retain_graph=False)
```
Result: 
`RuntimeError: leaf variable was used in an inplace operation`
